title: Seared Scallops with Pea Purée
description: Dry-seared scallops with a bright, silky English pea purée and a touch of lemon and mint. The scallops develop a golden crust while the purée provides a sweet, herbaceous counterpoint — a quick, elegant seafood starter or light main.

ingredients.notes: remove side muscle if present; room temperature
divided: most for purée, some for finishing scallops

ingredients.display_name: prosciutto or bacon slices, crisped and crumbled
microgreens or pea shoots for garnish

steps.text: Prepare scallops: pat scallops very dry with paper towels, remove and discard side muscle, season lightly with salt and pepper. Let sit at room temperature while preparing other components.
Cook aromatics for purée: melt most of the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat, add chopped shallot and crushed garlic and sweat until translucent and fragrant but not browned.
Add peas and stock: add peas to the saucepan with aromatics, pour in the stock, bring to a gentle simmer and cook until peas are very tender.

Blend purée: transfer peas and aromatics to a blender or food processor, add lemon juice, mint leaves if using, remaining butter, and cream if using; blend until very smooth. If too thick, add a splash of stock or water to achieve a silky consistency. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Keep purée warm: pass purée through a fine sieve if desired, then keep warm over a very low heat or in a warm bowl while scallops are seared.
Heat pan for scallops: heat a large heavy skillet (preferably stainless steel or cast iron) over high heat until very hot; add olive oil and swirl to coat.

Sear scallops: place scallops in the hot pan spaced apart without crowding. Sear undisturbed for about 1.5–2 minutes until a deep golden crust forms, then flip and sear the other side 1–1.5 minutes until opaque in the center. Add a small knob of butter at the end and spoon the foaming butter over the scallops for 20–30 seconds.

Rest and plate: remove scallops to paper towel briefly to release any excess oil, spoon pea purée onto plates, arrange scallops on top, finish with a drizzle of olive oil or the pan butter, scatter crisped prosciutto or microgreens, and a light grating of lemon zest if desired.
